metrics_conclusion: In terms of chords and melody, Terrorist Threats is more complex than the typical song, having above average scores in Chord Complexity, Melodic Complexity, Chord Progression Novelty and Chord-Bass Melody.
key_conclusion:
Terrorist Threats is written in the key of E♭ Lydian.  

According to the Theorytab database, it is the 11st most popular key among Lydian keys and     the 71st most popular  among all keys. The E♭ Lydian scale is similar to the E♭ Major scale except that its 4th note (A) is a half step higher.  Music written in Lydian often emphasizes this difference by creating melodies that feature this note.  Due to the dissonant interval between the 1st and 4th scale degrees, Lydian is less common in popular music.

See the E♭ Lydian Cheat Sheet for popular chords, chord progressions, downloadable midi files and more!
